conclusion: The initial distance from the piston to the bottom of the cylinder is: L1 = 19 cm.
The mass of the cylinder is: M = 4.5 kg.
The mass of the piston is: m = 3 kg.
The area of the piston is: S = 30 cm².
The atmospheric pressure is: p0 = 1.0 × 10^5 Pa.
The maximum tension the rope can withstand is: F = 120 N.
The gravitational acceleration is: g = 10 m/s².

premise: M = 4.5 kg, m = 3 kg, g = 10 m/s²
conclusion: Calculate the total weight of the cylinder and piston: W = (M + m)g = (4.5 + 3) × 10 = 75 N.
Calculate the maximum upward force that can be applied to the piston: Fmax = F - W = 120 - 75 = 45 N.
Calculate the maximum pressure that can be applied to the piston: pmax = Fmax/S = 45/30 = 1.5 Pa.

premise: L1 = 19 cm, pmax = 1.5 Pa, p0 = 1.0 × 10^5 Pa, S = 30 cm²
conclusion: Calculate the maximum distance that the piston can reach from the bottom of the cylinder: L2 = L1 + (pmax/p0) × S = 19 + (1.5/1.0 × 10^5) × 30 = 19 + 0.000045 × 30 = 19.00135 cm.
